results.title: Design for disaster
results.creator_credit: William Miller and Cinematography Unit, LA City Fire Department
results.brief_description: In 1959 brush fires in the Los Angeles forest area made fire officers describe the region as being a “design for disaster”. This film shows the fire in November 1961 which destroyed 250 homes, without loss of life. It explains its causes and tries to suggest possible remedies.
results.creator_credit_for_label: William Miller and Cinematography Unit, LA City Fire Department

results.title: Desalting the seas
results.creator_credit: Stephen Sinichak and Oak Ridge National Laboratory
results.brief_description: Describes the various methods of purifying salt water through the use of nuclear energy, with particular emphasis on nuclear electric desalting plants which produce large amounts of power as well as pure water. Describes the growing shortage of water in a famine-threatened world of expanding population, and ways to combat this.

results.title: Dental caries in South Africa
results.creator_credit: South Africa. Dept. of Education. Film Services Union
results.brief_description: The film depicts the incidence of the disease in various parts of South Africa, and deals with the following aspects: effects of fluoride; mottling and hypoplasia, contributory causes of decay; preventive measures; correct methods of brushing the teeth; correct diet; regular dental examination.

results.title: Denmark: [Paul Henningsen]
results.brief_description: A visual interpretation of the pattern and tempo of life in Denmark. Observes fishermen hauling in the catch; loading and unloading of cargo at the dock; farmers bringing their products to market and lighter side of life - holiday making and fun at the local carnival.
results.description: A visual interpretation of the pattern and tempo of life in Denmark. Observes fishermen hauling in the catch; loading and unloading of cargo at the dock; farmers bringing their products to market and lighter side of life - holiday making and fun at the local carnival.

results.title: Denmark
results.brief_description: A geographical film which deals with the commercial life and work of the Danes. It covers farming, shipyards, engineering, timber-working, matchmaking, boxing, and porcelain.

results.title: Denmark
results.brief_description: Denmark yesterday and today. After giving an idea of the appearance of Denmark the film outlines its history, showing burial mounds of the Bronze Age, and the appearance of churches and other buildings at different times. Also includes footage of the industries, sports and social services of Denmark today; views of Copenhagen; and the coronation of King Frederick.

results.title: Delegates
results.creator_credit: Derek Hart and Derek Hart Productions
results.brief_description: Shows Red Cross delegates in action in Lebanon. The role of the delegates is clearly portrayed as they visit families to discover their needs and distribute aid, act as mediators in tricky and often dangerous situations and to generally bring about peace and reduce human suffering

results.title: Delayed parenthood: pros and cons
results.brief_description: Looks at the increasing number of women who are having children later in life because of career pressure. Risks such as birth defects are examined and women who have had children later in life are interviewed.
